# MD/MS Dissertation Preparation Guide {background-color="#0284c7"}

Complete roadmap for postgraduate dissertation submission

::: notes
This is a comprehensive guide for MD/MS students preparing dissertations at ABVMUUP.
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Your Dissertation Journey

::: incremental
-   A comprehensive research document demonstrating mastery of your field
-   Combines literature review, original research, and critical analysis
-   Must follow ABVMUUP formatting and submission guidelines
-   Requires ethical approval and institutional endorsement
-   Final step before MD/MS degree completion
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## University Requirements at a Glance

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Copies to Submit** - 1 Hard Copy - 1 Soft Copy (PDF)

**Plagiarism Limit** - \<15% (Turnitin/Ithenticate)
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Paper Specifications** - A4, 85gsm, white bond - Arial 12pt

**References** - Vancouver Style (Numbered)
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Dissertation Components Roadmap

| Component | Details |
|---------------------------------------|---------------------------------|
| **Preliminary Pages** | Cover, Declaration, Certificates, Abstract, TOC, Lists |
| **Main Chapters (7)** | Introduction â†’ Methodology â†’ Results â†’ Discussion â†’ Conclusions |
| **Supporting Docs** | Ethics approval, ICF, data tools, plagiarism report |
| **Quality Checks** | Format compliance, References, Plagiarism verification |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## 8-Step Submission Process {background-color="#dbeafe"}

1.  Prepare manuscript & chapters
2.  Ethical approval obtained
3.  Guide/Co-guide certification
4.  HOD endorsement & Principal forward
5.  Format compliance check
6.  Plagiarism check (\<15%)
7.  Final review by all authorities
8.  Submit hard copy + PDF

**Abstract Structure (Max 200-300 words):** - âœ“ Introduction - Context & rationale - âœ“ Objectives - Primary & secondary - âœ“ Methods - Design & sample - âœ“ Results - Key findings - âœ“ Conclusion - Implications - âœ“ Keywords - 5-10 terms (semicolon-separated)

# Core Chapters {background-color="#dbeafe"}

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 1: Introduction Structure

::: incremental
-   **Background of Study:** General context & existing knowledge
-   **Need/Rationale:** Why research is important
-   **Statement of Problem:** Specific problem you're investigating
-   **Scope & Delimitation:** Boundaries of your research
-   **Expected Outcomes:** Anticipated benefits
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 2: Writing SMART Objectives

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Primary Objective** Single, well-defined main goal

**Secondary Objectives** Additional exploratory/sub-aims
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**SMART Criteria** - **S**pecific - **M**easurable - **A**chievable - **R**elevant - **T**ime-bound
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 3: Literature Review Strategy

::: incremental
-   **Search Strategy:** PubMed, Google Scholar, JSTOR databases
-   **Search Terms:** Keywords, MeSH terms, inclusion/exclusion
-   **Organization:** Thematic approach (not just summaries)
-   **Synthesis:** Compare studies, identify gaps, build narrative
-   **Critical Analysis:** Evaluate strengths, limitations, quality
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 4a: Study Design Selection

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Observational Designs** - Cross-sectional - Case-control - Cohort - Descriptive

**Qualitative Designs** - Phenomenology - Grounded theory - Ethnography
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Experimental Designs** - RCT - Quasi-experimental - Before-after

**Justification** Explain why this design is best for your research question
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 4b: Sample Selection & Size Calculation

| Aspect                  | Details                                        |
|-------------------------|------------------------------------------------|
| **Inclusion Criteria**  | Clear criteria for who participates            |
| **Exclusion Criteria**  | Conditions that disqualify participation       |
| **Sample Size Formula** | Power 80%, Î±=0.05 with parameter justification |
| **Sampling Method**     | Random, stratified, systematic, or purposive   |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 4c: Ethical Considerations & Data Collection

::: {style="background-color: #dcfce7; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #16a34a;"}
**Mandatory Requirements:** - âœ“ Ethical Approval from Institutional Ethics Committee - âœ“ Informed Consent Form (Hindi/English) - âœ“ Confidentiality & anonymization plan - âœ“ Pilot Study (10% sample) - âœ“ Validity & Reliability measures - âœ“ Data Collection Procedure (step-by-step)
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 4d: Statistical Analysis Plan

::: incremental
-   **Descriptive Statistics:** Mean, SD, frequencies, percentages
-   **Inferential Tests:** t-test, chi-square, ANOVA
-   **Significance Level:** p \< 0.05 (a priori specification)
-   **Software Used:** R, SPSS, Stata (with version)
-   **Missing Data:** Handling strategy documented
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 5: Results - Data Presentation

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Tables** - Numbered sequentially - Clear headings - Summary below

**Text Descriptions** - Present key findings - Statistical significance
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Figures** - Professional quality - Colored when appropriate - Descriptive captions

**No Interpretation** Discussion goes in Discussion chapter
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 6: Discussion - Analysis & Interpretation

::: incremental
-   **Key Findings Summary:** Recap main results in context of objectives
-   **Literature Comparison:** How findings align/differ from existing research
-   **Explanation of Results:** Why results occurred (mechanisms, theories)
-   **Limitations:** Be honest about study limitations
-   **Implications:** Practical, policy, and research implications
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Chapter 7: Conclusions & Recommendations

:::::: columns
::: {.column width="33%"}
**Key Conclusions** Brief synthesis of main findings
:::

::: {.column width="33%"}
**Recommendations (Practical & Policy)** Actionable steps for programs & policy
:::

::: {.column width="33%"}
**Future Research** Directions for further investigation
:::
::::::

# References: Vancouver Style {background-color="#e9d5ff"}

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Vancouver Style: Overview & Key Features

::: {style="background-color: #e9d5ff; padding: 20px; border-left: 4px solid #7c3aed;"}
-   **Numbered Citations:** Use \[1\], \[2\], \[3\] in text in order of appearance
-   **Reference List:** At end of manuscript, numbered to match in-text
-   **Standard Format:** Author(s). Title. Source. Year;Volume(Issue):Pages
-   **Wide Acceptance:** Standard in biomedical, public health, medical research
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Journal Article References

::: {style="background-color: #e9d5ff; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #7c3aed; margin: 10px 0;"}
**Format:** Author(s). Title of article. Journal Title. Year;Volume(Issue):Page numbers.
:::

::: {style="background-color: #e9d5ff; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #7c3aed; margin: 10px 0;"}
**Example:** Singh A, Kumar P, Sharma R. Prevalence of anemia in pregnant women: A cross-sectional study. *Indian J Public Health.* 2021;65(3):190â€“5.
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Books & Book Chapters

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Book Format**

Author(s). Title of book. Edition. Place: Publisher; Year.

**Example:** Park K. *Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine*. 26th ed. Jabalpur: Banarsidas Bhanot; 2021.
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Chapter Format**

Author(s). Title of chapter. In: Editor(s). Title of book. Place: Publisher; Year. p. pages.

**Example:** Bhargava M. Nutrition and health. In: Gupta S, editor. *Essentials of Community Medicine*. Delhi: Jaypee; 2020. p. 89â€“97.
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Government Reports & Datasets (NFHS-5, GATS)

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Report Format**

Author/Organization. Title. Place: Publisher; Year.

**Example:** Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (India). National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5), 2019â€“21: India Report. Mumbai: IIPS; 2021.
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Dataset Format**

Author/Organization. Title \[dataset\]. Place: Publisher; Year. Available from: URL

**Example:** NFHS. National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5), 2019â€“21: District Fact Sheet \[dataset\]. Mumbai: IIPS; 2021.
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Website & Internet Sources

::: {style="background-color: #e9d5ff; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #7c3aed; margin: 10px 0;"}
**Format:** Author/Organization. Title \[Internet\]. Place: Publisher; Year \[cited Year Month Day\]. Available from: URL
:::

::: {style="background-color: #e9d5ff; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #7c3aed; margin: 10px 0;"}
**Example (WHO Fact Sheet):** World Health Organization. Hypertension \[Internet\]. Geneva: WHO; 2023 \[cited 2025 Apr 24\]. Available from: https://www.who.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/hypertension
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Theses, Dissertations & Conference Papers

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Thesis Format**

Author. Title \[type of thesis\]. Place: Institution; Year.

**Example:** Kumar R. A study on dietary patterns among adolescents in Bareilly \[MPH thesis\]. Bareilly: Rohilkhand Medical College; 2023.
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Conference Format**

Author(s). Title. In: Proceedings; Date; Location. Place: Publisher; Year. p. pages.

**Example:** Verma N, Joshi M. Hypertension trends in rural India. In: Proceedings of 10th National Public Health Conference; 2022 Dec 5â€“7; New Delhi. NHP India; 2023. p. 102â€“4.
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Videos, Software & WHO Resources

:::::: columns
::: {.column width="33%"}
**Video Format**

Author/Channel. Title \[Internet\]. Place: Platform; Date \[cited date\]. Available from: URL
:::

::: {.column width="33%"}
**Software Format**

Name \[Internet\]. Version. Place: Publisher; Year \[cited date\]. Available from: URL
:::

::: {.column width="33%"}
**WHO Fact Sheet**

WHO. Title \[Internet\]. Geneva: WHO; Year \[cited date\]. Available from: URL

## Common Reference Formatting Mistakes {background-color="#fecaca"}

::: {style="background-color: #fecaca; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #dc2626;"}
-   âœ— **Missing Access Dates:** Always include \[cited date\] for internet sources
-   âœ— **Inconsistent Author Names:** Use abbreviations consistently (initials only)
-   âœ— **Wrong Punctuation:** Semicolons (;) between elements, not periods
-   âœ— **Incomplete Journal Info:** Always include volume(issue):pages
-   âœ— **Missing URLs:** Required for websites, datasets, online resources
-   âœ— **Undefined Abbreviations:** First use must be spelled out
:::

# Formatting Requirements {background-color="#fed7aa"}

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Paper & Print Specifications

| Aspect | Requirement |
|----------------------------|--------------------------------------------|
| **Paper Type** | High-quality, plain white, unlined bond, A4, 85gsm |
| **Font** | Arial, 12pt (body); 14pt bold (titles); 12pt bold (subtitles) |
| **Printing** | Letter quality or laser, dark black characters (NO dot matrix) |
| **Sides** | Use only ONE side of paper for all pages |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Spacing & Margins

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Margins** - Left: 1.5 inches (for binding) - Right, Top, Bottom: 1.0 inch

**Spacing** - Double spacing (body text) - Single spacing (footnotes, endnotes) - Triple space before/after equations
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Pagination** - Preliminary Pages: Roman numerals (i, ii, iii...) - Main Text: Arabic numerals (1, 2, 3...) - Placement: Center bottom or consistent position - Coverage: ALL pages including tables, figures, appendices
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Photographs, Figures & Diagrams

::: incremental
-   **Professional Quality:** High-resolution colored photographs
-   **Print Consideration:** Ensure figures print clearly in color AND B&W
-   **Standard Size:** Figures must fit on A4 pages
-   **Oversized Figures:** Must be folded with 1.5" left margin maintained
-   **Captions & Numbers:** Descriptive captions with figure numbers
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Data Management Best Practices

::: incremental
-   **Data Organization:** Maintain master data sheet with participant IDs & variables
-   **Backup Systems:** Keep multiple copies on external drives or cloud storage
-   **Confidentiality:** Use codes instead of names in datasets
-   **Version Control:** Save drafts with dates (Dissertation_v1, v2, v3)
-   **Data Cleaning:** Document corrections, validate entries before analysis
-   **Analysis Trail:** Document all statistical procedures performed
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Academic Integrity & Plagiarism Prevention

::: {style="background-color: #dcfce7; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #16a34a;"}
-   [x] **Always Cite Sources:** Use in-text citations \[1\]\[2\] for all references
-   [x] **Quote Marks:** Use quotation marks for direct quotes, include page numbers
-   [x] **Paraphrase Properly:** Rephrase in your own words + still cite source
-   [x] **Acknowledge Collaborators:** Mention anyone who contributed
-   [x] **Plagiarism Check Early:** Use Turnitin regularly during writing
-   [x] **Final Check:** Plagiarism report \<15% before submission
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Effective Communication with Your Guide

::: incremental
-   **Regular Meetings:** Schedule fortnightly or monthly meetings
-   **Preparation:** Come with specific questions and completed sections
-   **Feedback Implementation:** Incorporate suggestions promptly
-   **Timeline Discussion:** Establish clear deadlines for each chapter
-   **Acknowledge Help:** Thank guide in acknowledgments section
-   **Professional Conduct:** Maintain respectful, collegial communication
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Common Pitfalls to Avoid {background-color="#fecaca"}

::: {style="background-color: #fecaca; padding: 15px; border-left: 3px solid #dc2626; font-size: 0.9em;"}
-   âœ— **Too Broad Research Question:** Narrow scope for achievable objectives
-   âœ— **Inadequate Literature Review:** Must demonstrate knowledge gap thoroughly
-   âœ— **Methodological Flaws:** Improper sampling, uncontrolled confounders
-   âœ— **Poor Data Quality:** Inconsistent collection, missing values
-   âœ— **Weak Discussion:** Simply repeating results without interpretation
-   âœ— **Over-generalization:** Claims beyond study scope or sample
-   âœ— **Procrastination:** Starting late = rushed writing = low quality
:::
